com.esotericsoftware.kryo.io

Class FastInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • com.esotericsoftware.kryo.io.Input
        • com.esotericsoftware.kryo.io.FastInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public final class FastInput
extends Input
    Same as Input, but does not use variable length encoding for integer types.
    Author:
    Roman Levenstein

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FastInput()
      Creates an uninitialized Output.
      FastInput(byte[] buffer)
      Creates a new Output for writing to a byte array.
      FastInput(byte[] buffer, int offset, int count)
      Creates a new Output for writing to a byte array.
      FastInput(java.io.InputStream outputStream)
      Creates a new Output for writing to an OutputStream.
      FastInput(java.io.InputStream outputStream, int bufferSize)
      Creates a new Output for writing to an OutputStream.
      FastInput(int bufferSize)
      Creates a new Output for writing to a byte array.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int readInt(boolean optimizePositive)
      Reads a 1-5 byte int.
      long readLong(boolean optimizePositive)
      Reads a 1-9 byte long.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FastInput

        public FastInput()
        Creates an uninitialized Output. Input.setBuffer(byte[], int, int) must be called before the Output is used.

      • FastInput

        public FastInput(int bufferSize)
        Creates a new Output for writing to a byte array.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - The initial and maximum size of the buffer. An exception is thrown if this size is exceeded.

      • FastInput

        public FastInput(byte[] buffer)
        Creates a new Output for writing to a byte array.
        See Also:
        Input.setBuffer(byte[])

      • FastInput

        public FastInput(byte[] buffer,
         int offset,
         int count)
        Creates a new Output for writing to a byte array.
        See Also:
        Input.setBuffer(byte[], int, int)

      • FastInput

        public FastInput(java.io.InputStream outputStream)
        Creates a new Output for writing to an OutputStream. A buffer size of 4096 is used.

      • FastInput

        public FastInput(java.io.InputStream outputStream,
         int bufferSize)
        Creates a new Output for writing to an OutputStream.

    • Method Detail

      • readInt

        public int readInt(boolean optimizePositive)
            throws KryoException
        Description copied from class: Input
        Reads a 1-5 byte int. This stream may consider such a variable length encoding request as a hint. It is not guaranteed that a variable length encoding will be really used. The stream may decide to use native-sized integer representation for efficiency reasons.
        Overrides:
        readInt in class Input
        Throws:
        KryoException

      • readLong

        public long readLong(boolean optimizePositive)
              throws KryoException
        Description copied from class: Input
        Reads a 1-9 byte long. This stream may consider such a variable length encoding request as a hint. It is not guaranteed that a variable length encoding will be really used. The stream may decide to use native-sized integer representation for efficiency reasons.
        Overrides:
        readLong in class Input
        Throws:
        KryoException
